function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Analysis based on COVID-19 cases per million inhabitants and country's latitude could lead to oversimplified conclusions about disease propagation","Impact":"Inaccurate understanding of disease propagation, leading to ineffective mitigation strategies","Mitigation":"Include additional factors and variables in the analysis, consult with epidemiologists and public health experts","Technologies":"Statistical modeling, data visualization tools, collaboration platforms","People":"Public health officials, policymakers, epidemiologists, data analysts","Owner":"Data analysts, public health officials, policymakers"},{"Description":"Limited data set of 117 countries may not be representative of global disease propagation patterns","Impact":"Inaccurate or biased analysis of disease propagation, leading to ineffective mitigation strategies","Mitigation":"Seek to expand the data set to include more countries, consider regional and local data, consult with global health organizations","Technologies":"Data collection tools, global health databases, collaboration platforms","People":"Data analysts, researchers, global health organizations","Owner":"Data analysts, global health organizations"},{"Description":"Inability to control for differential testing intensity may skew the analysis of disease propagation","Impact":"Misleading conclusions about disease propagation and testing impact, leading to ineffective mitigation strategies","Mitigation":"Consult with experts to develop methods for controlling testing intensity bias, consider sensitivity analysis on testing intensity effects","Technologies":"Statistical modeling, sensitivity analysis tools, data visualization tools","People":"Epidemiologists, data analysts, public health officials","Owner":"Data analysts, public health officials"}]}
